intro: Canastra lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf canastra, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, well-drained soils. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens. Canastra lanceolata is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
